subject: Re: [junit] newbie: Tools to generate junit test (not skeleton)
msgSnippet: ... I don t know about free tools. I know that JTest can generate boundary test cases that check for 0, negative values and unchecked exceptions. My question:
messageBody:
jim_gustafson wrote:

> All,
>
> I was wondering if any of you know of a tool to automatically
> generate JUnit tests. I've looed at JUB in eclipse and the JUnit tool
> in NetBeans, but they just generate the sekleton (methods with no meat).
>
> Does anyone know of a FREE tool that will generate the test method for
> at least primitive types (int, double, float, boolean...)

I don't know about free tools. I know that JTest can generate boundary
test cases that check for 0, negative values and unchecked exceptions.

My question: how does a computer know what behavior you expect of a method?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
